Reviews.Title: “Great place wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: jabby2us
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Aina-Nalu Ginger Condo section. Wow what a gorgeous place. If ever we return to Maui (which I pray we do) this is definately the place I would love to stay. Don't know if Marlon & Luis is still there but they were great. Beautiful grounds, beautiful condo -- who could ask for anything more. The only negative to this trip was we were waken by a rooster really early in the morning. They obviously live close by. We were moved close by the pool and we did not have that problem any longer. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “1st. time in Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: pennyx3
Reviews.Content: It was great , price was good , they kept the rooms well stocked with T.P paper towels and other small stuff . If i ran out of shampoo they had it on hand. it was close to town. Every thing in walking distance . On the water frount the eateries had menu's on the out side so you could see the food and the $ amount before you went in. I had a great time. The only problem i ran into at the resort is they did not have enough loungers around the pools. and the ones they did have the vistors marked there loungers earley in the day and saved them alday long . other then that I had a Blast. sunny and bright all the time in the 80's penny

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time in 6 months and still great!”
Reviews.Author: sasakidalem
Reviews.Content: Had to return to Maui, so got on a waitlist for the Aina Nalu. Was glad to get in! As before, fantastic location, awesome friendly people, great room! Parking cost was higher $15/day for parking in only 1/4 full parking lot, but I guess it beat walking to the closest cheaper parking lots. Aina Nalu us great as it is condo/hotel allowing you to cook on your own or walk to very nearby restaurants including the likes of Burger King or reasonable and higher priced restaurants of all sorts. We love walking down Front Street to people watch, shop and take in the great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Lahaina!”
Reviews.Author: dabaum77
Reviews.Content: After deciding to visit Maui and to stay in Lahaina, we came across Aina Nalu. The price looked great (about half the cost of staying at the nearby resort hotels) and the recent reviews (after the remodel) were quite good, so we took a chance. Aina Nalu ended up being a fantastic choice! Based on recommendations in the reviews, we reserved a 1 br and contacted the hotel by e-mail to request a room on the second floor (stairs were not an issue for us) away from the highway. Both of these requests were met when we arrived. We did not have much of a view from our balcony, but there were plenty of other opportunities for amazing views. The window AC units worked fine, although we were not there during very hot weather. The location was fantastic. Front Street is just a short 2 block walk away, but the hotel was quiet. The public bus stop is just one block away, which allowed us to make a trip to the Maui Ocean Center without renting a car. The kitchen was nicely stocked with necessary cooking utensils and a grocery store is just about a 5 minute walk (as another review noted, definitely sign up for the free savings card to take advantage of additional deals). Housekeeping did a good job in terms of cleaning, but was not as good about replenishing some items. We had to ask for additional shampoo at the desk and very nearly ran out of toilet paper the last day. We searched all over our room (A209 I believe), but never did find the advertised wired internet. We were close enough to the lobby that we were able to pick up the wifi signal (weakly). There was no charge for the wifi. We also encountered one front desk lady who was a bit inattentive, but other staff members we encountered were very nice and helpful. Overall, we were very happy with our stay at Aina Nalu. We would definitely stay there again and would love to find similar places on each of the islands. Our stay was just before Thanksgiving 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Well furnished, great condo, okay location.”
Reviews.Author: w204
Reviews.Content: We picked this place primarily from the other reviews. We were given a 1 bedroom condo, and we were quite impressed at the quality of it. Furniture was well appointed but the renovations done to the condo was gorgeous. Kitchen was fully stocked. Price was great, but the only caveat is that the parking is $25 a day. While the location is a bit tucked away in Lahaina, it is a 5 minute walk to Front Street.

Reviews.Title: “COME STAY IN LAHAINA LIKE A RESIDENT RATHER THAN A TOURIST”
Reviews.Author: Tjomsland
Reviews.Content: Typically, Susan and I stay at one of the bizillion beach front resorts with an ocean view. This trip we were going for 11 days and thought we would like to see what living in Lahaina might be like. So, I did a read so many TripAdvisor reviews that you wouldn't believe. Then, I landed on the Aina Nalu Resort in downtown Lahaina and walking distance to all of the restaurants, stores, markets, etc. So, I booked our stay at the Aina Nalu. I was in a little quandary because of some of the negative reviews, but let the much larger number of positive reviews help to make my decision. We love it here. It is like living here rather being a tourist. All of the staff is very friendly. Unit K205 is warm, comfortable and cozy in a nice way. I phoned Aina Nalu ahead of time and made some requests all of which they met. I asked for a second floor unit away from the 2 lane highway going boy Lahaina. I also wanted the vaulted ceiling with skylights. I recommend that you always phone ahead and let the resort know your preferences. When ever possible they always seem willing to accommodate you. Our condo had airconditioning in all of the living areas as well as ceiling fans. However, by opening a few louvered windows, We were able to appreciate a lovely tropical breeze as well as listening to the sounds of the local birds in the morning. And, no, they were not roosters as one reviewer complained. This is an older, well maintained and updated resort. Come enjoy Maui as a resident rather than a tourist and enjoy your stay at the Ainu Nalu in downtown Lahaina. It is all a matter of your attitude when you travel anywhere. I also recommend that you travel to Hawaii between December 5th and depart no later than December 25th. You will get a better deal on everything and deal less with people.

Reviews.Title: “studio disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rcftommay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 206B at the Ainu Nalu in mid November 2011. We had been enticed to this property by its partnership with Hawaiian Airlines. After reading reviews here, we were looking forward to relaxing in a similar comfort to other hotels in the same price range we had stayed at on other Hawaiian islands. In most ways, we were very disappointed. The room was tiny, and there was no lanai. The bed was very uncomfortable, and there were only two spartan style chairs and a small dining table to relax at. The "Garden View" room overlooked a large parking lot. To be fair, the kitchen facility was adequate and the bathroom was fine. We also enjoyed the salt water pool an the recliners there. We expected the parking fee, so were not surprised by that. The location was excellent if you want to be within easy walking distance of all things Lahaina. We tried to upgrade, but were not able to; consequently, we spent as little time in the room as possible. We would not stay at this property again. RCF, Battle Ground, Washington

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MelBelle42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Aina Nalu for 6 nights in March in a 1 bedroom unit. The room itself was nicely updated with a gorgeous stone shower and washer/dryer. We loved the convenience of being within walking distance of Lahaina and, after spending $20-$30 on breakfast in town our first few mornings, took full advantage of the kitchen to cook our own breakfasts. We shopped at the local grocery store (make sure to sign up for a savings card - which is free - to save even more money) which also had a $1/night DVD rental we used one night when we just felt like relaxing inside. Although this hotel does not have an oceanfront location that many people look for in Hawaii, we are not the type of travelers that spend much time at the hotel, so the Aina Nalu was perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable setting”
Reviews.Author: sasakidalem
Reviews.Content: Not your touristy, large hotel complex, but a relaxing more local setting. It's really condominium rooms with only 2 stories and spread out like apartments. Very quiet and relaxing while just 2 blocks from Front St, Lahaina where all the 'action' is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Aina Nalu!”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2Travel23
Reviews.Content: Our family of five just returned from a week long stay at the Aina Nalu. We rented a two bedroom, two bathroom condo through a travel package. We arrived around 1 pm and check-in is 3 pm. No problem. The lady at the lobby checked us into our unit quickly and we were on our way. The unit has a nicely stocked kitchen with toaster, coffee pot, fridge, microwave, plates, glasses, pots, pans, and so on. We stocked up on groceries at Costco and ate every breakfast and some lunches in our condo. The Aina Nalu is quiet, except for when people walk by outside. The slatted glass windows do not offer sound proofing. This is not a big deal because most of the time, the Aina Nalu is very quiet and peaceful. The unit was clean and they even provide daily maid service and beach towels. There is also a washer/dryer in the unit, which was wonderful for washing wet bathing suits! The grounds and two pools are nice. There is wireless internet in the condo as well. The location is awesome. You are three blocks away from Front Street, which is right on the ocean. Lahaina is a great place to hang out and the sunsets are amazing. There are tons of great places to have a mai tai and watch the sunset over the Pacific. There is no shortage of restaurants, bars, shops, and shave ice vendors. During our last trip to Maui, we stayed in Kaanapali. However, we loved Lahaina so much that this time around we booked the Aina Nalu. I would stay here again for the value, space, and location in Lahaina. There were no problems during our stay and nothing that would prevent me from recommending this place. It was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zazzo67
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms with kitchen and refrigerator you have two pools and a hot tub there are 3 bbqs that you can use. Many rooms are a little dark but not too much. You have to pay parking and wifi is near pools.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: medanne1
Reviews.Content: This remodeled resort is right in the heart of Lahaina. The rooms are airy and the bathrooms to die for. There are two pools, one is huge and for the more socially outgoing, the smaller one is great for quiet reading or restful floating. The property has no restaurants or bars but they are all just a short walk away. Each unit has a kitchen but mainly I use it for morning coffee and late night drinks. The weather in Lahaina is the driest of any on Maui. You are guaranteed sunshine except for an occasional rainy day or two in winter.

Reviews.Title: “we won't be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: marienat
Reviews.Content: very difficult to understand all the positive reviews. I was very disapointed not so much by the hotel in general but by the room we got. Somebody said that the room you get depends on luck.. Well, I understand what he meant and we were not very lucky. The room was minuscule, dark, close to the highway and the bed was so small, it could not fit in the normal position (it was placed along side the wall). The larger pool opens only at 9:00 and is quickly filled with lots of kids. But the worst, we were badly bitten by bed bugs. There was a pest control operation when we were there (nothing wrong with that we are in the tropics) but it does not eliminate the bed bugs. I do not recommend this hotel and will not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous interiors, great city location you can walk to everywhere, Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: mauilovermomoftwo
Reviews.Content: I loved the 2 pools and so did my kids. The 2 bedroom was perfect for our family. The only bad thing about the trip was the rooster outside our window crowing like crazy early in the morning! My husband had to go outside and chase it to get it away. The other bad thing is the air conditioning units, they are loud. The rooms are wonderful. The bathrooms are very updated and nice tile showers. My kids want to go back. The parking was $15 but we easily found a spot on the street and walked to all the shopping and dinner very easily. Internet was free!!!! It was very nice. No lanai and you have to walk about 1 mile to the beach but the pools and lounge chairs were to die for. We stayed two nights and will probably return for the value and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spectacular price”
Reviews.Author: kquirk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aina Nalu condos with Kevin McDermott. He rents out one of the bedrooms in his condo and lives in the other one. He was extremely knowledgeable about Maui and Lahaina in particular. If you're looking to save a little money and stay in a clean, comfortable accommodation, this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a relaxing and romantic vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ArlynA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing!! From check-in to check-out it felt like a second home! We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen, living room, and we loved th shower and in room washer and dryer! Aina Nalu is walking distance from everything. We rarely drove! This place is a gem and I hope to experience this again! We love Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: davarello
Reviews.Content: This establishment was definitely beyond my expectations! First of all, the price was great - cheaper than most in the area. The location was ideal - its only two streets away from Front St where most of the restaurants and shops are. I have a hip replacement and i could easily walk it. There's complimentary wired internet access in the rooms and free wireless in the lobby and around the pools. Speaking of the pools, they're exquisite. The "big" pool as its referred to is surrounded by palms trees, the mountains in the background, and at night they have the garden flames burning and it creates such a tremendous atmosphere. It feels like how i imagined Hawaii to be. The rooms were well equipped. We stayed in a 1 bed unit which had a fully equipped kitchen, 2 flat screen TVs, a comfortable bed and an air conditioner and fan in both the TV room and bedroom. The concierge was very helpful and most of the front desk staff were friendly. We were able to get a late check out free of charge and the housekeeping service was quick and efficient. Being a condominium resort - there was no on site restaurant or room service, but there's a great little pasta place across the street. Parking is also available but costs $15 a night - you could try parking on the street but it looked very busy. The only thing i would recommend was to make sure you don't get a room near the pool room as it was a tad noisy. We had our air conditioning on for most of the time and didn't hear it, but it could be annoying with the air conditioner off. Over all i totally recommend this place and would definitely stay there again in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed by Aina Nalu!”
Reviews.Author: AmesK8
Reviews.Content: Returned to Aina Nalu with my partner and friend in May, after first visiting during Reno period in 2007. Wow was it ever beautiful! As previous the room decor was suitable Hawaiian w new black appliances. We had a two bedroom condo w one bath. Only issue was the second bdrm did not have it's own AC, so our friend had to keep her door open. While the saltwater pool & surrounding area is absolutely beautiful, we stuck to the freshwater pool. Also beautiful, usually uncrowded, always a chaise available. We also used the BBQs which worked fine. Location is perfect. I lie wing in Lahaina & being able to walk to dinner / socialize at night. Check out Penne just around the corner. Also there's a few grocery stores in close proximity for stocking the fridge. Also used Expedia concierge on site. Very handy!

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended for midweek stays!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmatecom
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu is a tropical oasis in Lahaina close to Front Street and the hustle and bustle the small former fishing village can offer but far off the huge hotel bunkers ashore. The grounds are lush, well maintained, and offer two pools and several BBQ spots. You either can rent the one or two bedroom apartments over private owners (cheaper) at vrbo.com or the Outrigger Hotel. So far I only stayed within the private owner apartments and had nothing to complain about since all units are furnished the same and only â€“ if at all - differ in accessories. Unfortunately Outrigger started to get sloppy with the house rules over the years. The closer the weekend gets the louder your fellow vacationers and some of their kids are getting. If the worst comes to the worst you are facing overcrowded pools with high level screaming kids starting before the official pool hours or adults partying all night connecting several apartments with each other. This might be a huge issue if you are looking for a relaxing and quiet stay away from the crowds. In this case you should take a closer look into Kapalua further north from Lahaina, an upscale but very quiet and small community with rental apartments/homes along golf courses and high-class hotels. If you toy with the idea of staying in areas like Wailea, Kaanapali, Napili be aware of a gapless arrangement of overdone mega resorts and their guests. Nevertheless I still recommend my followers on travelin-mate.com to choose Aina Nalu over any other hotel or B&B on Maui. But I recommend selecting the apartment location well. Stay off the pool areas and only in the second floor, away from Wainee Street where the check-in and the street side parking is located. And finally donâ€™t pay the outrageous parking fees! Save the 15 bucks per night and look for free parking along Wainee Street instead. In the morning and evening after 6pm you should easily find a spot! Lahaina itself is a lovely small village with its center along Front Street and the ocean offering surf and souvenir shops, galleries, and in- and outdoor restaurants, most situated at the ocean with marvelous view towards Lanai. The only downside are the plenty â€˜visitor informationsâ€™ offering cheap tours and luaus to pedestrians. Taking a closer look those kiosks turn out to be collecting pits for timeshare sales! Their offers come hours of sales meetings! Parallel to Front Street you will find two supermarkets (Foodland and Safeway) and several shopping centers with local and national designers and chains. Lahaina is only 30-40 minutes by car away from Kahului (airport), 1hr from Road to Hana and Haleakala volcano. It has much more charm than Wailea, Kanaapali, Napili and offers next to a great beginner surf-spot, the best snorkel spot on the island and several golf courses. This post was written by the editor of www.travelin-mate.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryCanuck
Reviews.Content: When I booked the hotel I was hesitant as the price was much lower than other establishments, but I booked it based on TA anyway. To summarize: Pros: + I booked a 1 bedroom and it was very spacious and clean + There is a shopping/restaurant complex one block (2-3 minutes walk) away + Minutes from Front Street (main shopping street) and harbor for excursions + Staff was friendly and helpful with any inquiries + Pools were pretty quiet, free BBQ and free internet/wifi Cons: + No real view from the hotel as it is in the city + Parking is $15 a day + No front desk services at night (only some security staff) The hotel isn't perfect, but given the price, it exceeded my expectations. As some tips, street parking is free so you don't need to pay for hotel parking if you are on a budget. There is a lot (about 1.5 blocks to the west of the hotel) that is $5 a day and one right beside that at $12 a day. You can buy snacks/drinks cheaply at the ABC Store all around Front street if you want to stock up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: palmer77
Reviews.Content: I kept thinking if I got a room this size at the resorts down the road it would have been 1 thousand a night. We stayed in g101 and they just put in new air so it was not as loud as some have suggested. In my opinion, Lahaina is the best location on the island and this is centrally located there. The pools were nice and yes there were kids running around but it's a family place. Don't come here expecting anything but a clean well appointed room, pretty Polynesian style decor, and nice pools. If you want service and beach front go to the Westin but don't complain about service and parking when it's only 185 per night. Suck it up and pay the extra 15 bucks. if you can't afford that......what the heck are you doing in Maui :)......overall I highly recommend this. Oh yeah...all that money we saved.....we just spent at Mamas Fish House and a helicopter ride for Xmas!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, quiet but in walking distance of restaurants, beaches and all activities”
Reviews.Author: Sue0408
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu is a marvelous resort, situated in Lahaina, on a quiet street, 5 minutes away from all the restaurants, harbour, beaches. You can find there large, full equiped suites, kitchen, even two bathrooms. The resort has two pools, one of them with salt water. Depending if you want peace and quietness or people around you, you can choose one or the other. Barbecue and Internet connection available around the pool. The only bad point; you have to pay for your parking. I was there with two teenies - they loved it (and me too) specially the freedom to just walk to the beach, go surfing, to the massage salon (just around the corner), grab a sandwich, etc. And, the pleasure to hang around for dinner or breakfast, just getting up when you feel like it. .. We know one thing. If we go back to Hawaii, we'll choose Maui and the Aina Nalu again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great units, Great Price, Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Thorfamily
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu Condos two blocks from Front street, Lahaina. Pros: Two blocks from Front street, Lahaina. Right across from Snorkel Bob's. Nice kitchen Awesome open stone showers. Great Bedrooms. The large pool is the bomb! Expedia rep. at the pool so you can book your tours, Lua, etc.. while chillin at the pool. Great property for families and couples. Cons: Staff was not very helpful when our electronic room key (card) died. We rented directly from the owner and paid about $100 less a night then renting thru the outrigger, so that is probably why they weren't very keen on helping us. But, we were able to charm the gal at the desk into helping the poor dumb tourists. Parking $15 a day. (The lots were mostly empty. Lots of folks parked on the street) Overall: Ready to go back. Awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Dzhugashvili
Reviews.Content: Aina Nalu is a large, multi-building, 2 story condo complex about 2 blocks from Front Street. The facility is first rate. There are two pools, a hot tub, a spacious club house, a grilling area, and the grounds are well kept. We stayed in unit I-109 for 13.5 days and paid $100 per day not including tax, cleaning or parking. It was a two-bedroom, 2 bath unit of approximately 900 square feet. It appears the units were renovated around 2005 or 2006. A king bed is located in the master bedroom while a queen is in the 2nd bedroom. The unit includes everything you need including kitchen appliances and utensils and a washer/dryer. The A/C is composed of three wall units, one for each bedroom and one in the living room. The units are anemic and extremely noisy. You won't be able to sleep if the A/C is in the economy mode. Louver windows are present in all rooms but there's not much of a breeze. Parking is $15 per day and the front desk will not let you pay on a day-by-day basis. We paid to park on the complex grounds for the first week but parked on the street thereafter. There are parking spots on the street adjacent to the complex, there are 3 spots across the street in front of Snorkel Bob's and there's a $5 lot one block northwest on Wainee St. (the street that runs alongside the complex). Use caution when choosing a unit to rent. Some of the buildings are within spitting distance of the highway and non-stop traffic noise. Also, the State is currently building a concrete wall along the highway and they start work early in the morning. My biggest complaint abouy this stay was the company I used to rent the unit. I will never rent a condo through Maui Beachfront Rentals again! They quoted me one price when I initially comtacted them, then changed it to a higher price when it was time to sign the contract. After inquiring about the price change, they lowered it back to the original quote. Throughout my communications with MBR, I emphasized that I needed the unit for an additional half day due to a late flight. Even though I paid for the additional half day, and it was written into the contract, and during my stay I called MBR to remind them that I was checking out late, the cleaning crew arrived at noon on our last day. The cleaning crew wouldn't leave until I proved to them that I was entitled to the unit until midnight. Mary of MBR took a "too bad for you" attitude when I expressed my displeasure.

HotelInfo.Name: Aina Nalu Lahaina
HotelInfo.Address: 660 Wainee Street, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
